panels.description: Total time spent in the statement, in seconds
panels.title: SQL Time

panels.description: Number of times executed, in seconds
panels.title: SQL Executions

panels.description: Active connections in this state
panels.title: Active conn.

panels.description: Number of connections
panels.title: Connection count

panels.description: Number of rows fetched by queries in this database
panels.title: rows fetched

panels.description:
- It indicates the buffer cache hit rate.
- = sum(blks_hit) / sum(blks_hit + blks_read)

targets.expr:
(
(sum(rate(pg_stat_database_blks_hit{alias=~"$alias"}[$intv] offset $diff_intv)) by (alias)) / 
( sum(rate(pg_stat_database_blks_hit{alias=~"$alias"}[$intv] offset $diff_intv)) by (alias) + sum(rate(pg_stat_database_blks_read{alias=~"$alias"}[$intv] offset $diff_intv)) by (alias) )
)
>= ((1-$use_diff)*100000000000000000000000000000000000000000)

panels.title: blks_hit_ratio

panels.description: Total time the statement spent reading data file blocks, in milliseconds (if track_io_timing is enabled, otherwise zero)
panels.title: blk_read_time

panels.description: Number of transactions in this database that have been committed
panels.title: commit_count

panels.description: Total number of deadlocks detected
panels.title: deadlock_count

panels.description: Number of times the background writer stopped a cleaning scan because it had written too many buffers
panels.title: maxwritten_clean_total

panels.description: Number of queries canceled due to conflicts with recovery in this database. (Conflicts occur only on standby servers; see pg_stat_database_conflicts for details.)
panels.title: conflicts

panels.description: Number of temporary files created by queries in this database. All temporary files are counted, regardless of why the temporary file was created (e.g., sorting or hashing), and regardless of the log_temp_files setting.
panels.title: temp files created

panels.description: Top SQL ordered by Elapsed Time

targets.expr:
topk(200, 
     sum ((pg_stat_topsql_seconds_total{alias=~"$alias"} -
           pg_stat_topsql_seconds_total{alias=~"$alias"} offset $__range)
          or pg_stat_topsql_seconds_total{alias=~"$alias"})
    by (job, alias, instance, queryid, sql_text, datname, user) 
    )

topk(200, 
     sum ((pg_stat_topsql_calls_total{alias=~"$alias"} -
           pg_stat_topsql_calls_total{alias=~"$alias"} offset $__range)
          or pg_stat_topsql_calls_total{alias=~"$alias"})
    by (job, alias, instance, queryid, sql_text, datname, user) 
    )

topk(200, 
     sum ((pg_stat_topsql_rows_total{alias=~"$alias"} -
           pg_stat_topsql_rows_total{alias=~"$alias"} offset $__range)
          or pg_stat_topsql_rows_total{alias=~"$alias"})
    by (job, alias, instance, queryid, sql_text, datname, user) 
    )

panels.title: Top SQL ordered by Elapsed Time

panels.description: Total time the statement spent reading data file blocks, in milliseconds (if track_io_timing is enabled, otherwise zero)

panels.description: Number of disk blocks read in this database
panels.title: blks_read

panels.description: Number of times disk blocks were found already in the buffer cache, so that a read was not necessary (this only includes hits in the PostgreSQL buffer cache, not the operating system's file system cache)
panels.title: blks_hit

panels.description:
- It indicates the buffer cache hit rate.
- = sum(blks_hit) / sum(blks_hit + blks_read)

targets.expr:
(
(sum(rate(pg_stat_database_blks_hit{alias=~"$alias"}[$intv] offset $diff_intv)) by (alias)) / 
( sum(rate(pg_stat_database_blks_hit{alias=~"$alias"}[$intv] offset $diff_intv)) by (alias) + sum(rate(pg_stat_database_blks_read{alias=~"$alias"}[$intv] offset $diff_intv)) by (alias) )
)
>= ((1-$use_diff)*100000000000000000000000000000000000000000)

panels.title: blks_hit_ratio

panels.description: Number of transactions in this database that have been committed
panels.title: commit_count

panels.title: lock count

panels.description: Number of times the background writer stopped a cleaning scan because it had written too many buffers
panels.title: maxwritten_clean_total

panels.title: buffers_alloc_total

panels.description: Number of times a backend had to execute its own fsync call (normally the background writer handles those even when the backend does its own write)

panels.description: Number of buffers written directly by a backend
panels.title: buffers_backend_total

panels.description: Number of buffers written during checkpoints
panels.title: buffers_checkpoint_total

panels.description: Number of buffers written by the background writer
panels.title: buffers_clean_total

panels.description:
- checkpoint execution count
- checkpoints_timed + checkpoints_req
- checkpoints_timed: Number of scheduled checkpoints that have been performed
- checkpoints_req: Number of scheduled checkpoints that have been performed
panels.title: Checkpoint

panels.description: Total amount of time that has been spent in the portion of checkpoint processing where files are written to disk
panels.title: checkpoint_write_time

panels.description: Total amount of time that has been spent in the portion of checkpoint processing where files are synchronized to disk
panels.title: checkpoint_sync_time

panels.description: Number of buffers written during checkpoints
panels.title: checkpoint_buffers

panels.description: Number of queries canceled due to conflicts with recovery in this database. (Conflicts occur only on standby servers; see pg_stat_database_conflicts for details.)
panels.title: conflicts

panels.description: Number of queries in this database that have been canceled due to pinned buffers
panels.title: conflicts_bufferpin

panels.description: Number of queries in this database that have been canceled due to lock timeouts
panels.title: conflicts_lock

panels.description: Number of queries in this database that have been canceled due to old snapshots
panels.title: conflicts_snapshot

panels.description: Number of queries in this database that have been canceled due to dropped tablespaces
panels.title: conflicts_tablespace

panels.description: Total size of WAL segments

panels.title: Failed WAL files

panels.title: current_wal_lsn_bytes

panels.description: Time in seconds since last WAL segment was successfully archived

panels.title: WAL lsn_diff

panels.description: Disk space used by the database

panels.description: Number of temporary files created by queries in this database. All temporary files are counted, regardless of why the temporary file was created (e.g., sorting or hashing), and regardless of the log_temp_files setting.
panels.title: temp files created

panels.description: Total amount of data written to temporary files by queries in this database. All temporary files are counted, regardless of why the temporary file was created, and regardless of the log_temp_files setting.
panels.title: temp write (bytes)

panels.description: Age of the oldest transaction ID that has not been frozen.
panels.title: Max Age (Frozen XID)
